articles.headline: China Shifts Away From Low-Cost Factories
articles.snippet: As costs rise, factories are revamping, helping build a middle class and encouraging sustainable growth.
articles.abstract: As costs rise, factories are revamping, helping build a middle class and encouraging sustainable growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: DONGGUAN, China  Companies here in China’s industrial heartland are toiling to reinvent their businesses, fearing that the low-cost manufacturing that helped propel the nation’s economic ascent is fast becoming obsolete.

articles.headline: Craigslist Says It Has Shut Its Section for Sex Ads
articles.snippet: At a House Judiciary Committee hearing, Craigslist also defended its right to post sex-related ads as well as its efforts to fight sex trafficking.
articles.abstract: At a House Judiciary Committee hearing, Craigslist also defended its right to post sex-related ads as well as its efforts to fight sex trafficking.
articles.lead_paragraph: Craigslist said on Wednesday that it had permanently closed the section of its sites in the United States that carried sex-related advertising, but it defended its right to carry such advertisements as well as its efforts to fight sex trafficking.

articles.headline: Geithner to Signal Tougher Stance on China Currency
articles.snippet: The treasury secretary plans to testify on Thursday that China has kept the value of its currency artificially low.
articles.abstract: The treasury secretary plans to testify on Thursday that China has kept the value of its currency artificially low.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is moving to take a harder stance on the Chinese government’s trade and currency policies, with anger toward China rising in both political parties ahead of midterm elections.

articles.headline: Rethinking Investments After a Flight to Security
articles.snippet: Four financial advisers offer a variety of ideas for investing with significantly better yields than C.D.’s or money market funds while limiting risk.
articles.abstract: Four financial advisers offer a variety of ideas for investing with significantly better yields than C.D.’s or money market funds while limiting risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHAKEN by what seemed to be an earthquake in the world’s financial markets two years ago, millions of retirees fled to safety, shifting their holdings into savings accounts, Treasury bills, money market funds or certificates of deposit. Now they are suffering the aftershocks: with short-term interest rates well below 1 percent, their assets are not producing enough income for daily living expenses.

articles.headline: Poll Suggests Opportunities for Both Parties
articles.snippet: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll found widespread dissatisfaction with President Obama and voters’ own members of Congress.
articles.abstract: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll found widespread dissatisfaction with President Obama and voters’ own members of Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: Republicans are heading into the general election phase of the midterm campaign backed by two powerful currents: the highest proportion of voters in two decades say it is time for their own member of Congress to be replaced, and Americans are expressing widespread dissatisfaction with President Obama’s leadership.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Megan Thee-Brenan

articles.headline: Looking Ahead to the Spend-Down Years
articles.snippet: Researchers are increasingly trying to come up with effective approaches for retirees to turn their accumulated savings into retirement income.
articles.abstract: Researchers are increasingly trying to come up with effective approaches for retirees to turn their accumulated savings into retirement income.
articles.lead_paragraph: IMAGINE you’re 30 and trying to figure out how much to save for retirement. You consult a Web site that can show you what you will most likely look like at 65  and that shows the more you save now, the happier you will look then.

articles.headline: A Device Sold Before Its Time
articles.snippet: The new Vulkano — a combination TiVo and Slingbox — from Monsoon Multimedia is riddled with problems.
articles.abstract: The new Vulkano — a combination TiVo and Slingbox — from Monsoon Multimedia is riddled with problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: What if you were offered magical powers  but at a price?

articles.headline: Rebel Republican Marching On, With Baggage
articles.snippet: Some Republicans fear Christine O’Donnell’s conservative positions could make her a tough sell in Delaware.
articles.abstract: Some Republicans fear Christine O’Donnell’s conservative positions could make her a tough sell in Delaware.
articles.lead_paragraph: DOVER, Del. — In the bright light of Wednesday morning, Christine O’Donnell, whose Republican primary victory upended the calculus for future control of the United State Senate, became quickly known to Americans as the woman who once made dire warnings about the negative impact of masturbation.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Steinhauer and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: Japan’s Move on Yen Lacks Global Support
articles.snippet: Japan’s decision to intervene in the currency markets has not gained the backing of its trading partners.
articles.abstract: Japan’s decision to intervene in the currency markets has not gained the backing of its trading partners.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO  Japan’s decision to intervene in currency markets to weaken the yen and shore up its export-driven economy could be only the first step in a long battle  one made more difficult because Japan, unable to find support among its trading partners, must go it alone.

articles.headline: U.S. to Sell G.M. Stake Over Time
articles.snippet: How long it takes for the government to divest its holdings in General Motors will, in part, be determined by the company’s success, G.M.’s chief executive said.
articles.abstract: How long it takes for the government to divest its holdings in General Motors will, in part, be determined by the company’s success, G.M.’s chief executive said.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  He is the fourth chief executive at General Motors in less than 18 months, but Daniel F. Akerson set out Thursday to show there is now stability at the top of the nation’s biggest automaker  and that his ascension signals a clear break with the past.

articles.headline: U.S. Steps Up Criticism of China’s Practices
articles.snippet: Lawmakers expressed impatience with the administration’s reliance on persuasion and negotiation, saying such tactics had not worked with China.
articles.abstract: Lawmakers expressed impatience with the administration’s reliance on persuasion and negotiation, saying such tactics had not worked with China.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration increased its criticism of China’s economic policies on Thursday, as Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner told Congress that China had substantially undervalued its currency to gain an unfair trade advantage, tolerated theft of foreign technology and created unreasonable barriers to American imports.

articles.headline: Recession Raises Poverty Rate to a 15-Year High
articles.snippet: The report said that 44 million people, or one in seven residents, lived in poverty in the United States in 2009, the highest rate since 1994.
articles.abstract: The report said that 44 million people, or one in seven residents, lived in poverty in the United States in 2009, the highest rate since 1994.
articles.lead_paragraph: The percentage of Americans struggling below the poverty line in 2009 was the highest it has been in 15 years, the Census Bureau reported Thursday, and interviews with poverty experts and aid groups said the increase appeared to be continuing this year.
